flash.tools.debugger

Interface SwfInfo

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DSwfInfo, ThreadSafeSwfInfo

    public interface SwfInfo
    The SwfInfo object contains information relating to a particular swf file that was loaded by the Player. Each SWF file contains a list of actionscript source files from which execution is performed. It is important to note 2 or more SWF files may contain multiple copies of the same source code. From the Player's perspective and the API perspective these copies are unique and it is up to the user of the API to detect these 'duplicate' files and either filter them from the user and/or present an appropriate disambiguous representation of the file names. Also internally they are treated as two distinct files and thus breakpoints will most likely need to be set on both files independently.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean containsSource(SourceFile f)
      Returns true if the given source file is contained within this SWF.
      int getIsolateId()
      Return the worker ID to which this SWF belongs.
      String getPath()
      The full path of the SWF.
      int getSourceCount(Session s)
      Number of source files in this SWF.
      SourceFile[] getSourceList(Session s)
      List of source files that are contained within this SWF.
      int getSwdSize(Session s)
      The size of the debug SWD file, if any This may also be zero if the SWD load is in progress
      int getSwfSize()
      The size of this SWF in bytes
      String getUrl()
      The URL for the SWF.
      boolean isProcessingComplete()
      Indicates whether the contents of the SWF file have been completely processed.
      boolean isUnloaded()
      Indication that this SWF, which was previously loaded into the Player, is now currently unloaded.

    • Method Detail

      • getPath

        String getPath()
        The full path of the SWF.

      • getUrl

        String getUrl()
        The URL for the SWF. Includes any options at the end of the URL. For example ?debug=true

      • getSwfSize

        int getSwfSize()
        The size of this SWF in bytes

      • getSwdSize

        int getSwdSize(Session s)
               throws InProgressException
        The size of the debug SWD file, if any This may also be zero if the SWD load is in progress
        Throws:
        InProgressException - if the SWD has not yet been loaded

      • isUnloaded

        boolean isUnloaded()
        Indication that this SWF, which was previously loaded into the Player, is now currently unloaded. All breakpoints set on any of the files contained within this SWF will be inactive. These breakpoints will still exist in the list returned by Session.getBreakpointList()

      • isProcessingComplete

        boolean isProcessingComplete()
        Indicates whether the contents of the SWF file have been completely processed. Completely processed means that calls to getSwdSize and other calls that may throw an InProgressException will not throw this exception. Additionally the function and offset related calls within SourceFile will return non-null values once this call returns true.
        Since:
        Version 2

      • getSourceCount

        int getSourceCount(Session s)
                   throws InProgressException
        Number of source files in this SWF. May be zero if no debug
        Throws:
        InProgressException - if the SWD has not yet been loaded

      • getSourceList

        SourceFile[] getSourceList(Session s)
                           throws InProgressException
        List of source files that are contained within this SWF.
        Throws:
        InProgressException - if the SWD has not yet been loaded
        Since:
        Version 2

      • containsSource

        boolean containsSource(SourceFile f)
        Returns true if the given source file is contained within this SWF.
        Since:
        Version 2

      • getIsolateId

        int getIsolateId()
        Return the worker ID to which this SWF belongs.
